headline: 5 Insightful Analyst Questions From Otis’s Q4 Earnings Call
summary: Otis’s fourth quarter results reflected a negative market reaction as the company missed Wall Street’s revenue expectations, despite delivering year-on-year top-line growth and meeting profit consensus. Management attributed the underperformance primarily to softer-than-anticipated new equipment sales, particularly in China and The Americas, and a lower-than-expected trajectory in repair within the service segment. CEO Judith Marks highlighted the company’s robust modernization orders and strong

headline: Otis Gen3 EMEA Launch And Board Move Shape Service Focus
summary: Otis Worldwide (NYSE:OTIS) has launched its Gen3 elevator lineup in Europe, the Middle East, and Africa, featuring Otis ONE IoT connectivity, predictive maintenance, passenger safety functions, and energy-efficient options. The Gen3 family introduces digital and customization features aimed at building owners and facility managers who want data driven monitoring and tailored rider experiences. Separately, Otis CFO Cristina Méndez has joined the Board of Textron, adding cross industry board...
